sentence.Network_en: When he was sixteen he joined a religious sect.
sentence.Network_cn: 他16岁的时候加入了一个宗教教派.

sentence.Network_en: Each religious sect in the town had its own church.
sentence.Network_cn: 该城每一个宗教教派都有自己的教堂.

sentence.Network_en: He was rejoiced at so early an opportunity of distinguishing his faith in his new sect.
sentence.Network_cn: 他很高兴这么快就能有机会表明他新近才参加的教派的信仰.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French secte or Latin secta, literally 'following', hence 'faction, party', from the stem of sequi 'follow'

entry.def: A sect is a group of people that has separated from a larger group and has a particular set of religious or political beliefs.

means.word_mean: 1. a subdivision of a larger religious group

auth_sentence.content: Essentially, they were a small sect within Judaism.
